Posts.Content: super-sandra wrote: Hello I have never entered anything on a forum before, but on stumbling across this site I thought it may be helpful, to me, if I did.  I recently detected a lump, which subsequently turned out to be a large cyst which I then had aspirated.  The mammogram detected a cluster of calcifications in my right breast.  The doctor told me these are indeterminate - a biopsy was done 3 days ago and I go back for the results next week - it feels like forever, though will only have been 7 days.  The Advanced Practitioner that carried out the biopsy informed me that the calcifications are very fine grains like sand - I can only assume that means they are micro calcifications?  I have no other information as I could not take anything in at the time, which is very frustrating as ordinarily I like to know everything there is to know!  I have read so much about calcifications and the information that I have about my situation does not read very favourably.  Has anyone else found themselves in a similar situation?  I'm just very worried! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: stereotactic biopsy super-sandra super-sandra
